bcl:part.bcl:text: Disposition of Timber by the Government

bcl:division.bcl:text: Forms of Rights to Crown Timber

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to the Land Act and the Park Act, rights to harvest Crown timber must not be granted by or on behalf of the government except in accordance with this Act and the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter on behalf of the government into an agreement granting rights to harvest Crown timber in the form of a

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forest licence,
[Repealed 2004-36-4.]
timber licence,
tree farm licence,
community forest agreement,
first nations woodland licence,
woodlot licence,
licence to cut,
free use permit,
Christmas tree permit, or
road permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A timber sales manager may enter on behalf of the government into an agreement granting rights to harvest Crown timber in the form of a

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: timber sale licence,
forestry licence to cut, or
road permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, eligible application means an application made in response to an invitation for applications under subsection (2) that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is made by an applicant

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who has tendered as required under subsection (2) (b),
whom the minister or a person authorized by the minister considers to be qualified to perform the obligations specified under subsection (3) (c), and

who is in a category of applicants established by regulation, if the application is for a non-replaceable forest licence and the minister has specified that applications for those licences must only be accepted from one or more categories of applicants established by regulation as set out in subsection (2.1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conforms to subsection (3), and
is not rejected under section 81 (3) or refused under section 81 (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request or on the minister's own initiative and by advertising in the prescribed manner, the minister or a person authorized by the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may invite applications for a forest licence, and
in doing so, must require that the applicant by written tender in a sealed container propose only a bonus bid or only a bonus offer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may specify that applications for a non-replaceable forest licence must only be invited, under subsection (2), from one or more categories of applicants as established by regulation.
An application for a forest licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form required by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,
include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7,

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the forest licence, but, at the licensee's discretion, was not cut and removed, and
either a bonus bid or bonus offer, whichever is required under subsection (2), in the amount tendered, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include any information that the minister or a person authorized by the minister may require about the applicants' qualifications to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: carry out timber harvesting operations under the licence, or
perform specified obligations

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the licence, or
in respect of the licence or its holder, under this Act or another enactment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt of applications and tenders in response to an invitation advertised under subsection (2), the minister or a person authorized by the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
may decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the applicant referred to in subsection (4) does not enter into a forest licence as required under subsection (6), the minister or a person authorized by the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the next highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
may decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an eligible application is approved under this section, the minister and the applicant whose application is approved must enter into a forest licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Direct award of forest licence to produce bioenergy

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: [Repealed 2011-18-2.]
An application for a non-replaceable forest licence under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form required by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,

specify an allowable annual cut for the forest licence that is considered by the minister to be consistent with the maximum allowable annual cut for a timber supply area specified by the minister under section 13.2 (b), and
include any information that the minister or a person authorized by the minister may require about the applicant's qualifications to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: carry out timber harvesting operations under the licence, or
perform specified obligations

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the licence, or
in respect of the licence or its holder, under this Act or another enactment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt of an eligible bioenergy application, the minister or a person authorized by the minister must approve the application.
The approval of an eligible bioenergy application under subsection (3) is revoked

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the British Columbia Hydro and Power Authority or the applicant terminates the bioenergy supply contract before the commercial operation date, or
if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an approved eligible bioenergy application is rejected under section 81 (3) or refused under section 81 (5), and
the applicant has not brought the application into compliance with section 81 (3) or (5), as applicable, within 90 days following the commercial operation date.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister and the applicant of an approved eligible bioenergy application must enter into a non-replaceable forest licence on or after the commercial operation date if, on the commercial operation date, the application

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is not rejected under section 81 (3) or refused under section 81 (5), or
is rejected under section 81 (3) or refused under section 81 (5) but is brought into compliance with section 81 (3) or (5), as applicable, within 90 days following the commercial operation date.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the applicant refuses to enter into a forest licence under subsection (5)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the approval of the eligible bioenergy application under subsection (3) is revoked, and

the minister or a person authorized by the minister may increase the allowable annual cut specified in an existing forest licence entered into under this section by the volume of the allowable annual cut that was to be specified in the forest licence the applicant refused to enter into under subsection (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to setting out the matters described in section 14 (1), a forest licence entered into under subsection (5)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must provide that timber harvested under the licence is restricted to a type of timber or terrain, or portion of a timber supply area, and
may include other terms and conditions that the minister considers are necessary or desirable in relation to the bioenergy supply contract.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Designation of bioenergy supply contracts and specification of allowable annual cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 13.1, the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: designate an energy supply contract as a bioenergy supply contract, and
specify the maximum allowable annual cut in a timber supply area that may be subject to one or more bioenergy supply contracts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A forest licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 20 years, subject to sections 15 and 16,
must specify a timber supply area or tree farm licence area in which the holder of the licence may harvest Crown timber,
may require, subject to subsection (2), that timber harvesting under the licence be restricted to one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a portion of a timber supply area;
a type of timber;
a type of terrain,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must specify an allowable annual cut that may be harvested under the licence, subject to sections 15 and 16,
if it provides that a replacement for it must not be offered, must specify the maximum volume of timber that may be harvested under the licence,
must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7,

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the forest licence, but, at its holder's discretion, is not cut and removed, and
a bonus bid or bonus offer, whichever is required under section 13, in the amount tendered under that section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must provide for cutting permits with terms that do not exceed 4 years to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the forest licence and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize its holder to harvest the allowable annual cut, from specified areas of land within the timber supply area or tree farm licence area specified in the forest licence,
[Repealed 2003-30-2.]
may make provision for timber to be harvested by persons under contract with its holder,

that is entered into with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, must state that it is a condition of the licence that the first nation comply with the agreement,

may require that the amount of timber on Crown land under the forest licence that is available to the holder of the forest licence be reduced by a specified amount of timber for a specified period of time for the purpose of entering into one or more BCTS licences, respecting all or part of the specified amount of timber, with one or more persons other than the holder of the forest licence, and

may include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement described in subsection (1) (b.1) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the forest licence already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the forest licence agrees to include the requirement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a replacement for a replaceable forest licence, unless paragraph (a) (i) or (ii) of this subsection applies in relation to the replaceable forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement described in subsection (1) (g.2) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless the holder of the forest licence agrees to include the requirement;
a replacement for a replaceable forest licence, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the forest licence already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the forest licence agrees to include the requirement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence that replaces a tree farm licence or forest licence under section 16, or that replaces or amends a forest licence under section 19, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence or forest licence that is replaced or amended already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the forest licence that replaces a tree farm licence or forest licence, or that replaces or amends a forest licence, agrees to include the requirement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council, by regulation, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: designate Crown land infested by mountain pine beetles as a mountain pine beetle salvage area for a prescribed period, and
repeal or amend a regulation under paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A forest licence that includes all or part of a mountain pine beetle salvage area, in addition to setting out the matters described in section 14 (1), may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require any type of security, including but not limited to money, to be provided and maintained by the holder of the forest licence to ensure

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: within a specified period or according to a required schedule of construction, or both, the construction or expansion of a timber processing facility that conforms to specified requirements, and
the reforestation of areas described in the licence by reference to one or more of geographic location, type of timber and type of terrain,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: at a rate of reforestation, and
over a period

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specified in the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specify one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the type of security that is acceptable or unacceptable;
the form and content of the security;
the circumstances under which the security may be realized;
respecting the distribution of the realized security,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that its holder may not harvest under the licence until the timber processing facility has been substantially completed to the satisfaction of the minister, and
[Repealed 2014-7-2.]
include other terms and conditions that the minister considers are necessary or desirable in relation to mountain pine beetle infestation in the mountain pine beetle salvage area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a forest licence referred to in subsection (2)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: requires security to be provided and maintained, as described in paragraph (a) of that subsection, and
the holder of the licence has provided the security,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the minister by notice served on the holder may cancel the licence in the circumstances specified under paragraph (b) (iii) of that subsection.
In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: restricted forest licence means a non-replaceable forest licence entered into under section 13 (6) for which applications are invited on or after July 1, 2011 from one or more categories of applicants as established under section 13 (2.1);
supplemental forest licence means a restricted forest licence that includes the condition described in subsection (2) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A supplemental forest licence, in addition to setting out the matters described in section 14 (1), must specify that timber may be harvested under the licence only if the minister is satisfied that the holder of the licence has taken the steps specified in the licence to obtain from other sources the timber and wood residue needed for processing facilities owned or leased by the holder.
In respect of a supplemental forest licence, the requirement in section 14 (1) (e) is subject to the condition referred to in subsection (2) of this section.
In this section, forest licence means a forest licence other than one that provides that a replacement for it must not be offered.

During the period beginning 6 months after the fourth anniversary of a forest licence and ending on the ninth anniversary, the minister or a person authorized by the minister may offer the holder of the forest licence a replacement for it, after first giving the holder at least 2 months' notice of intent to offer the replacement.

During the 6 months beginning on the ninth anniversary of a forest licence for which a replacement has not by then been offered under subsection (1.1), the minister or a person authorized by the minister must offer the holder of the forest licence a replacement for it.
Despite subsection (1.2), if the minister or a person authorized by the minister determines that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rights under the existing forest licence are under suspension, or
the holder of the existing forest licence has failed to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: pay stumpage or other money payable in respect of timber harvested under the forest licence or a road permit associated with the forest licence,
provide security or a deposit required under this Act or the Forest and Range Practices Act in respect of the forest licence or a road permit associated with the forest licence,
perform an obligation under the forest licence to be performed by the holder in respect of an area of land specified in

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a cutting permit previously issued under the forest licence, or
a road permit associated with the forest licence, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with a requirement under this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Wildfire Act in respect of an area of land referred to in subparagraph (iii),

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the minister or a person authorized by the minister, to the extent provided in the regulations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may decline to offer a replacement for the existing forest licence until

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the suspension is rescinded,
the suspended rights are reinstated, or
the holder of the existing forest licence

bcl:clause.bcl:text: pays the stumpage or other money payable,
provides the required security or deposit,
performs the obligation to be performed under the existing forest licence in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), or
complies with the requirement under this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Wildfire Act in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may offer a replacement with special conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A forest licence offered under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: have a term beginning

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the forest licence is replaced under subsection (1.1), on the earlier of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the next anniversary of the existing forest licence being replaced under the offer, and

the immediate past anniversary of the existing forest licence being replaced under the offer, if the minister or a person authorized by the minister and the holder of the forest licence agree in writing,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the forest licence is replaced under subsection (1.2), on the tenth anniversary of the existing forest licence being replaced under the offer, or
if the minister or a person authorized by the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), on a date to be determined by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term equal to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 15 years, or

if the minister or a person authorized by the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), a period, not exceeding the period referred to in subparagraph (i), to be determined by the minister or a person authorized by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specify the timber supply area specified in the existing forest licence,

subject to takings, reductions and deletions authorized or required under this Act, specify an allowable annual cut that may be harvested under it equal to the allowable annual cut under the existing forest licence, and
include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, set out in the offer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice of intent to offer a replacement referred to in subsection (1.1) and an offer of replacement made under subsection (1.2) must be published in the prescribed manner.
An offer made under this section may be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: amended, and
accepted by written notice of acceptance served on a person designated by the minister not later than 3 months after the offer is served.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is accepted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forest licence containing the terms and conditions set out in the offer, including amendments, must be entered into by the minister and the holder of the forest licence, and
the forest licence then in force expires on the commencement of the replacement licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is not accepted, the existing forest licence continues in force until its term expires, after which it has no further effect.
No forest licence is renewable.
The holder of one or more tree farm licences or of any number of both tree farm licences and forest licences may apply to the minister to surrender all or part of them for replacement under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subsection (2), by one or more forest licences, or
subsections (2) and (3), by a combination of one or more tree farm licences and one or more forest licences.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister has approved an application under subsection (1), the minister, in respect of the surrendered licences or surrendered portions of them, must enter with their holder into one or more forest licences

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a term of 15 years,
that specify one or more timber supply areas within which the holder may harvest Crown timber, and
that, in total, specify an allowable annual cut equal to the total, or a lesser portion of the total that the minister and the holder agree on, of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cuts specified in the surrendered forest licences, plus increases and minus decreases, if any, in the allowable annual cuts made by the government since they were entered into, and

the portion of the allowable annual cuts available to the tree farm licence holder at the time of the surrender that the chief forester determines is attributable to the Crown land in the portions of the tree farm licences that are surrendered and on which the timber is not otherwise encumbered.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If part of a tree farm licence is surrendered under subsection (1), the minister, in respect of the portion that is not surrendered, must enter with the holder into a new tree farm licence.
The minister must not enter into a new tree farm licence under subsection (3) until a management plan for the proposed tree farm licence is approved under section 35.2.
A notice of the surrender and proposed replacement under subsection (1) must be published in the prescribed manner.
[Repealed 2004-36-6.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transfer to other timber supply area
bcl:section.bcl:text: With the approval of the minister and the consent of the holder of a forest licence, all or part of the cutting rights authorized under the forest licence may be transferred from one timber supply area to another for a term specified by the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consolidation and subdivision of forest licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: [Repealed 2009-8-2.]
Subject to this section, the minister, by one or more of the methods set out in subsection (5), may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replace 2 or more forest licences held by the same person for the same timber supply area with one of those forest licences or a new forest licence held by that person for that timber supply area, or
amend a single forest licence held by a person for a timber supply area and enter into one or more forest licences held by that person for that timber supply area,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the minister first receives the consent of the holder of the licences or licence.
Subject to this section, the minister, by a method or combination of methods under subsection (5), must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replace 2 or more forest licences held by the same person for the same timber supply area with one of those forest licences or a new forest licence held by that person for that timber supply area, or
amend a single forest licence held by a person for a timber supply area and enter into one or more forest licences held by that person for that timber supply area,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the holder requests the replacement or amendment by written request delivered to the minister.
The minister may refuse to replace or amend, under subsection (3), one or more forest licences if the minister considers that the replacement or amendment would compromise forest management.
For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), the methods are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reducing the allowable annual cut specified in a forest licence and increasing the allowable annual cut for one or more other forest licences by a volume equal to the reduction;
amending or cancelling a forest licence;
entering into one or more forest licences.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a replacement or amendment referred to in subsection (2) or (3), the minister must ensure that the total of the allowable annual cuts, after the replacements, amendments or both, of all of the forest licences involved remains the same as it was immediately before any replacements or amendments under this section.
A forest licence as described

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in paragraph (a) of the definition of "licence" in section 75.4 (1), or
in section 75.5

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: may not be replaced under subsection (2) or (3) except with a forest licence that is also a forest licence as described

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in paragraph (a) of the definition of "licence" in section 75.4 (1), or
in section 75.5.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A replaceable forest licence may not be replaced under subsection (2) or (3) except with a forest licence that is also replaceable.

A forest licence that provides that a replacement for the forest licence must not be offered may not be replaced under subsection (2) or (3) except with a forest licence that also provides that a replacement for it must not be offered.
Despite section 14 (1) (a), a forest licence that is amended or entered into under this section must not expire later than the earliest expiry date of the forest licence it replaces or amends.
In this section, eligible application means an application made in response to an invitation for applications under subsection (2) that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is made by an applicant who has tendered as required under subsection (2) (b),
conforms to subsection (3), and
is not rejected under section 81 (3) or refused under section 81 (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request or on his or her own initiative and by advertising in the prescribed manner, the timber sales manager

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may invite applications for a timber sale licence, and
in doing so,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: may specify that applications for the timber sale licence are to be accepted only from one or more categories of BC timber sales enterprises as established by regulation, and
must require that the applicant by written tender in a sealed container propose only a bonus bid or only a bonus offer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for a timber sale licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form required by the timber sales manager, and
include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7,

if the timber sale licence will describe one or more areas of land within which its holder may harvest Crown timber, waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the timber sale licence, but, at the licensee's discretion, is not cut and removed, and
either a bonus bid or bonus offer, whichever is required under subsection (2), in the amount tendered.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt of applications and tenders in response to an invitation advertised under subsection (2), the timber sales manager

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
at the direction of the minister, must decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the applicant referred to in subsection (4) does not enter into a timber sale licence as required under subsection (6), the timber sales manager

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the next highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
may decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an eligible application is approved under this section, the timber sales manager and the applicant whose application is approved must enter into a timber sale licence.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 4 years,
must describe

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one or more areas of land within which its holder may harvest Crown timber, or
the location of logs that are being sold,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may specify a volume or an estimate of the volume of timber that may be harvested from an area of land described in the timber sale licence,
[Repealed 2004-36-9.]
may include provisions

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specifying standards and programs established by one or more standard making bodies,
requiring the holder of the licence to meet the standards and programs specified under subparagraph (i), and
specifying the manner in which the holder of the licence must conduct operations under the licence in order to meet the standards and programs specified under subparagraph (i),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may specify when and how a bonus offer required under section 20 must be paid and, if the bonus offer may be paid in instalments, the amount of each instalment,
must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7,

if the timber sale licence describes one or more areas of land within which its holder may harvest Crown timber, waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the timber sale licence, but, at its holder's discretion, is not cut and removed,
if a bonus bid is required under section 20, a bonus bid in the amount tendered under that section, and

if a bonus offer is required under section 20, a bonus offer in the amount tendered under that section, at the times and in the manner, if any, specified in the timber sale licence, unless the holder of the licence is exempt under section 22.1 from the requirement to pay the bonus offer, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the timber sales manager.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption from requirement to pay bonus offer

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a timber sale licence for which a bonus offer was tendered is not required to pay the bonus offer if the licence is surrendered or expires before any Crown timber is harvested under the timber sale licence.
In this section and sections 22.3 and 22.4:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: BCTS disposition agreement means a BCTS disposition agreement referred to in subsection (2);
non-BCTS licence means a forest licence, tree farm licence, community forest agreement, first nations woodland licence or woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a BCTS disposition agreement on behalf of the government for the purposes of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: allowing the holder of a non-BCTS licence to temporarily release to the government some of the holder's rights to harvest Crown timber under the non-BCTS licence, and
making the released rights available for disposition, to persons other than the holder of the non-BCTS licence, in the form of one or more BCTS licences.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may not enter into a BCTS disposition agreement that would allow for the release of rights to harvest Crown timber under a non-BCTS licence if any of the rights under the non-BCTS licence are under suspension, in whole or in part, under section 76.
A BCTS disposition agreement

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must describe the rights that the holder of the non-BCTS licence is releasing to the government, including identifying the non-BCTS licence under which those rights are held,
must specify the consideration to be provided by the government to the holder of the non-BCTS licence for the value of the rights released to the government,
may provide that the BCTS disposition agreement ends on a specified date, and
may provide for any other matter the minister considers necessary for the purposes of subsection (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exclusive right to harvest Crown timber under a tree farm licence, community forest agreement, first nations woodland licence or woodlot licence is subject to the right to harvest Crown timber under a BCTS licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rights to harvest Crown timber under the tree farm licence, community forest agreement, first nations woodland licence or woodlot licence are released to the government under a BCTS disposition agreement, and
the BCTS licence is entered into or granted as a result of the release of rights referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Nothing under this section, or under a BCTS disposition agreement entered into under this section, limits the application of any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reservation referred to in section 35 (1) (h) or (n), 43.3 (1) (g.2) or 43.55 (1) (h.1);

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Volume harvested under BCTS licence deemed to be harvested
under non-BCTS licence for cut control purposes
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "volume of timber harvested" in section 75.1 (1) and the definition of "volume of timber harvested" in a licence referred to in section 75.11 (1), if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rights to harvest Crown timber under a non-BCTS licence are released to the government under a BCTS disposition agreement, and
a BCTS licence is entered into or granted as a result of the release of rights referred to in paragraph (a),

bcl:section.bcl:text: the amount of timber that is merchantable Crown timber that is removed under the BCTS licence is deemed to be harvested under the non-BCTS licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payment for timber respecting non-BCTS licence with reduction

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, reduced non-BCTS licence means a non-BCTS licence that includes a requirement referred to in section 14 (1) (g.2), 35 (1) (n.1), 43.3 (1) (g.3), 43.55 (1) (h.2) or 45 (1) (f.2).

The minister, in accordance with the regulations, must pay to the holder of a reduced non-BCTS licence the amount determined in accordance with the regulations for the amount of timber that is disposed of under a BCTS licence.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Compensation is not payable by the government and proceedings must not be commenced or maintained to claim compensation from the government or to obtain a declaration that compensation is payable by the government in respect of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the enactment of this Division, or

obligations, including silviculture and other forest management obligations imposed under the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act or the Forest and Range Practices Act, that apply to an agreement resulting from or entered into under any of sections 24.2 to 24.9 as those sections read immediately before their repeal.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Permanent transfer to adjacent timber supply area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: direct that the right to harvest timber under a forest licence be transferred from one timber supply area to an adjacent timber supply area specified by the minister, and
amend the forest licence to give effect to the direction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must not give a direction under subsection (1) transferring the right to harvest timber under a forest licence from one timber supply area to an adjacent timber supply area, unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the boundaries between the timber supply area specified in the forest licence and the adjacent timber supply area have been changed under this Act,
the minister is satisfied that the change in boundaries increased the area of the adjacent timber supply area to a size sufficient to support the transferred right to harvest timber, and
the holder of the forest licence consents.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, original licence means a forest licence that is the subject of an order under subsection (2).
If a timber supply area has been divided under section 7 (b), the minister may order that the allowable annual cut under a forest licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be fully allocated to one of the timber supply areas resulting from the division, or
be allocated, in the proportions specified in the order, between or among 2 or more of the timber supply areas resulting from the division.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an order is made under subsection (2), the minister, in accordance with subsection (4), must issue to the holder of the original licence one or more forest licences in substitution for the original licence.
A forest licence issued under subsection (3)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must specify one of the timber supply areas resulting from the division and authorize an allowable annual cut as necessary to give effect to the order of the minister under subsection (2),
must specify a term that expires on the expiry date of the original licence,

is replaceable on the same terms and conditions as the original licence, if the original licence is replaceable under section 15, and in that case, for the purpose of determining the obligations pertaining to replaceability under the new licence, the new licence is deemed to have been issued at the same time as the original licence, and
subject to subsection (5), must otherwise be on the same terms and conditions as the original licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After giving the holder of the original licence an opportunity to be heard, the minister, at the time of issuing a licence under subsection (3), may include in it terms and conditions that vary from those in the original licence to the extent only that the minister considers necessary in order to take into account the allocation referred to in subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:text: If a tree farm licence expires or otherwise terminates and is not replaced under section 36, a timber licence that is then in the tree farm licence area

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: expires one year after the expiry or termination of the tree farm licence, and
may be replaced by a timber licence under section 28.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Rights not in tree farm licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who holds a timber licence that is due to expire under section 27 (a) may submit to a person designated by the minister, within 6 months after expiry or termination of the tree farm licence, a schedule proposing a time and a sequence for the orderly harvesting of the merchantable timber that is subject to the licence.

After considering a schedule proposed under subsection (1), the minister, in a notice served on its holder within 3 months after receiving the schedule, must offer to the holder one or more timber licences that, subject to section 74,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe the Crown land subject to the timber licence, and
expire on a date specified in the timber licence by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The offer may be accepted by written notice served on a person designated by the minister not later than 3 months after it is made.
If the offer is accepted, the minister and the holder must enter into a timber licence.
A notice of an offer made under subsection (3) must be published in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the minister considers that efficient forest planning and management would be served, he or she must enter into one timber licence under section 28 (4) for 2 or more timber licences.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: With the consent of the holder of a timber licence, the minister may consolidate 2 or more timber licences into a timber licence and, to achieve the consolidation, may do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: partition or subdivide a timber licence into 2 or more timber licences;
delete all or part of the licence area from a timber licence and add the deleted area to the licence area of another timber licence;
cancel a timber licence if the area covered by the licence has been added to the licence area in another timber licence;
amend a timber licence;
enter into one or more timber licences covering the same land as was covered in the licences being consolidated, subdivided or partitioned.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A timber licence that is amended or entered into under this section must not expire later than the latest expiry date of the timber licences it replaces or amends.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe an area of Crown land over which it is to apply,
be for a term determined under this Division,
grant to its holder the exclusive right during its term to harvest all merchantable timber in the area of Crown land described in it,

if the timber licence is in a tree farm licence area, require its holder to harvest timber in accordance with the tree farm licence and the management plan for the tree farm licence approved under section 35.2,

provide for cutting permits with terms that do not exceed 4 years to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the timber licence and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize the holder of the timber licence to harvest Crown timber from specified areas of land within the area of Crown land described in the timber licence,
require its holder to pay the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7, and
waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the timber licence, but at its holder's discretion, is not cut and removed, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Extension of term of timber licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: On application of the holder of a timber licence, the minister may extend the term of the licence for a period not exceeding 3 years if the licence is in effect on April 26, 2004 and the application is made

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: before the expiration of the term, or
despite the expiration of the term, if the term expires on April 26, 2004 and before the elapse of 60 days after May 13, 2004.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless a timber licence is in a tree farm licence area, if the minister determines that all or any part of the area of land that is subject to the licence is needed for a purpose other than timber production, the minister, in a notice served on the holder of the licence, may require that the merchantable timber on that area or that part be harvested within the time specified in the notice.
On the expiry of the specified time, or of an extension of that time granted by the minister, the minister may delete from the licence the area of land described in the notice.
In this section, eligible application means an application made in response to an invitation for applications under subsection (4) that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is made by an applicant

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: who has tendered as required under subsection (5) (b), and
whom the minister or a person authorized by the minister considers to be qualified to perform the obligations specified under subsection (5) (c),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conforms to subsection (5), and
is not rejected under section 81 (3) or refused under section 81 (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request or on the minister's own initiative, the minister or a person authorized by the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: convene a public hearing in which any person may make a submission as to whether or not a specified area should become a tree farm licence area, and
determine the procedures for the public hearing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After a public hearing under subsection (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: review the submissions made during the hearing and any other information he or she considers relevant, and
recommend to the Lieutenant Governor in Council whether or not the specified area referred to in subsection (2) (a) should become a tree farm licence area, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on receiving the recommendation of the minister, the Lieutenant Governor in Council, by order, may

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: authorize the minister to invite applications for a tree farm licence for all or part of the specified area, or
decline to do so.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister receives authorization under subsection (3) (b) (i), he or she, by advertising in the prescribed manner,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may invite applications for a tree farm licence, and
in doing so, must require that the applicant by written tender in a sealed container propose only a bonus bid or only a bonus offer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for a tree farm licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form specified by the minister,
include an offer by the applicant to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7,

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the tree farm licence, but, at the licensee's discretion, is not cut and removed, and
either a bonus bid or bonus offer, whichever is required under subsection (4), in the amount tendered, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include any information that the minister or a person authorized by the minister may require about the applicants' qualifications to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: carry out timber harvesting operations under the licence, or
perform specified obligations

bcl:clause.bcl:text: under the licence, or
in respect of the licence or its holder, under this Act or another enactment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt of applications and tenders in response to an invitation advertised under subsection (4), the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
may decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the applicant referred to in subsection (6) does not enter into a tree farm licence as required under subsection (8), the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may approve the eligible application of the applicant whose proposed bonus bid or bonus offer is the next highest of those tendered by all applicants with eligible applications, or
may decline to approve any of the eligible applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (10), if an eligible application is approved under this section, the minister and the applicant whose application is approved must enter into a tree farm licence.

The minister may reserve from disposition under this Act the timber in an area that is the subject of a public hearing convened under subsection (2) or described in the advertising referred to in subsection (4), pending the entering into of a tree farm licence or the rejection of all applications submitted under this section.
The minister must not enter into a tree farm licence under this section until a management plan for the proposed tree farm licence area is approved under section 35.2.
A tree farm licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to section 36 (3) (a), be for a term of 25 years,

subject to sections 33 and 39, describe a tree farm licence area, determined by the minister or a person authorized by the minister, comprising Crown land, the timber on which is unencumbered except by the licence, and if the area includes

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: private land, or
Crown land subject to a timber licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: also comprising that land,
require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7 for timber harvested under the tree farm licence on Crown land or under a timber licence on Crown land in the tree farm licence area,

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the tree farm licence or timber licence, but, at the licensee's discretion, is not cut and removed, and
a bonus bid or bonus offer, whichever is required under section 33, in the amount tendered under that section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to this Act and the licence, grant to its holder the exclusive right to harvest from the tree farm licence area during the term of the tree farm licence one or both of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: Crown timber of one or more types specified in the tree farm licence,
Crown timber from one or more types of terrain specified in the tree farm licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide for cutting permits with terms that do not exceed 4 years to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the tree farm licence and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize its holder to harvest the allowable annual cut available to its holder from specified areas of land within the tree farm licence area,
[Repealed 2010-12-7.]
require that timber on the tree farm licence area, in an amount directed by the minister, having regard to reservations made by the minister for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: BC timber sales enterprises,
pulpwood agreements, or
woodlot licences,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is to be available for disposition under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: timber sale licences or forestry licences to cut, or
Division 7 or 8 of this Part

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to persons other than the holder of the tree farm licence,
make provision for its holder to use the services of one or more professional foresters to manage the tree farm licence area,
require that each year during its term a volume of timber not less than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 50% of the volume of timber harvested by or for its holder from the tree farm licence area during the year, multiplied by
the result obtained by the division of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the portion of the allowable annual cut available to its holder during that year that the chief forester determines is attributable to Crown land referred to in paragraph (b) and sections 37 (1) and 38, by
the allowable annual cut available to its holder during that year

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: are to be harvested by persons under contract with its holder,
allow its holder to contract for the harvesting of more than the volume calculated under paragraph (j),
provide that the minister, under the regulations, may relieve the holder, in whole or in part, from the requirement under paragraph (j),
[Repealed 2003-30-2.]
reserve to the government the right to enter into a free use permit on the tree farm licence area with a person other than the holder of the tree farm licence,

may require that the amount of timber on Crown land within the tree farm licence area that is available to the holder of the tree farm licence be reduced by a specified amount of timber for a specified period of time for the purpose of entering into one or more BCTS licences, respecting all or part of the specified amount of timber, with one or more persons other than the holder of the tree farm licence, and
contain other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement described in subsection (1) (n.1) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a tree farm licence entered into before March 7, 2017, unless the holder of the tree farm licence agrees to include the requirement;
a replacement for a replaceable tree farm licence, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the tree farm licence agrees to include the requirement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a tree farm licence that replaces a tree farm licence under section 16, or that replaces or amends a tree farm licence under section 39, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence that is replaced or amended already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the tree farm licence that replaces or amends a tree farm licence agrees to include the requirement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A disposition of timber under Division 3 or 7 of this Part pursuant to this section, or pursuant to a requirement referred to in subsection (1) (h), does not give rise to any right to or eligibility for compensation under this Act or otherwise.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Management plan for tree farm licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A management plan for a tree farm licence may be approved in accordance with the regulations if the management plan

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is submitted in accordance with the regulations, and
conforms to prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A management plan approved under subsection (1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is effective for the period of time specified in the regulations, and
may be replaced or extended in accordance with the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The tree farm licence holder must comply with a management plan approved under subsection (1) or replaced or extended under subsection (2).
The requirements in a tree farm licence respecting the content of a management plan do not apply to a management plan approved under subsection (1) or replaced or extended under subsection (2).
In this section, tree farm licence means a tree farm licence other than one that provides that a replacement for it must not be offered.

During the period beginning 6 months after the fourth anniversary of a tree farm licence and ending on the ninth anniversary, the minister may offer the holder of the tree farm licence a replacement for it, after first giving the holder at least 2 months' notice of intent to offer the replacement.

During the 6 months beginning on the ninth anniversary of a tree farm licence for which a replacement has not by then been offered under subsection (1.1), the minister must offer the holder of the tree farm licence a replacement for it.
Despite subsection (1.2), if the minister determines that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rights under the existing tree farm licence are under suspension, or
the holder of the existing tree farm licence has failed to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: pay stumpage or other money payable in respect of timber harvested under the tree farm licence or a road permit associated with the tree farm licence,
provide security or a deposit required under this Act or the Forest and Range Practices Act in respect of the tree farm licence or a road permit associated with the tree farm licence,
perform an obligation under the tree farm licence to be performed by the holder in respect of an area of land specified in

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a cutting permit previously issued under the tree farm licence, or
a road permit associated with the tree farm licence, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with a requirement under this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Wildfire Act in respect of an area of land referred to in subparagraph (iii),

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the minister, to the extent provided in the regulations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may decline to offer a replacement for the existing tree farm licence until

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the suspension is rescinded,
the suspended rights are reinstated, or
the holder of the existing tree farm licence

bcl:clause.bcl:text: pays the stumpage or other money payable,
provides the required security or deposit,
performs the obligation to be performed under the existing tree farm licence in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), or
complies with the requirement under this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Wildfire Act in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may offer a replacement with special conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A tree farm licence offered under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term equal to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 25 years, or
if the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), a period, not exceeding 25 years, to be determined by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: have a term beginning

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the tree farm licence is replaced under subsection (1.1), on the earlier of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the next anniversary of the existing tree farm licence being replaced under the offer, and

the immediate past anniversary of the existing tree farm licence being replaced under the offer, if the minister or a person authorized by the minister and the holder of the tree farm licence agree in writing,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the tree farm licence is replaced under subsection (1.2), the tenth anniversary of the existing tree farm licence being replaced under the offer, or
if the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), on a date to be determined by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to sections 37, 38 and 39, describe as a tree farm licence area the area subject to the existing tree farm licence, and
include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, set out in the offer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice of intent to offer a replacement referred to in subsection (1.1) and an offer of replacement made under subsection (1.2) must be published in the prescribed manner.
An offer made under this section may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be amended, and
be accepted by written notice of acceptance served on the minister not later than 3 months after the offer is served.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is accepted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a tree farm licence containing the terms and conditions set out in the offer, including amendments, must be entered into by the minister and the holder of the tree farm licence, and
the existing tree farm licence expires on the commencement of the replacement licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is not accepted, the existing tree farm licence continues in force until its term expires, after which it has no further effect.
No tree farm licence is renewable.

On the expiry of a timber licence that is held by the holder of a tree farm licence and that is in the tree farm licence area, the land that was subject to the timber licence remains in the tree farm licence area and continues to be subject to its provisions.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Private land that is transferred to the government remains subject to a tree farm licence if the private land is in the tree farm licence area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consolidation and subdivision of tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: [Repealed 2009-8-4.]
Subject to this section, the minister, by a method or combination of methods under subsection (5), may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replace 2 or more tree farm licences held by the same person with one of those tree farm licences held by that person or a new tree farm licence held by that person, or
amend a single tree farm licence held by a person and enter into one or more tree farm licences held by that person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the minister first receives the consent of the holder of the licences or licence.
Subject to this section, the minister, by a method or combination of methods under subsection (5), must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replace 2 or more tree farm licences held by the same person with one of those tree farm licences held by that person or a new tree farm licence held by that person, or
amend a single tree farm licence held by a person and enter into one or more tree farm licences held by that person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the holder requests the replacement or amendment by written request delivered to the minister.
The minister may refuse to replace or amend, under subsection (3), one or more tree farm licences if the minister considers that the replacement or amendment would compromise forest management.
For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), the methods are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deleting all or part of the licence area from a tree farm licence and adding the deleted area to the licence area of another tree farm licence;
cancelling a tree farm licence if the area covered by the licence has been added to the licence area in another tree farm licence;
amending a tree farm licence;
entering into one or more tree farm licences covering the same land as was covered in the licences being replaced.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister makes a replacement or amendment referred to in subsection (2) or (3), the total of the allowable annual cuts, after the replacements, amendments or both, of all of the tree farm licences involved must remain the same as it was immediately before any replacements or amendments under this section.

A tree farm licence as described in paragraph (c) of the definition of "licence" in section 75.4 (1) may not be replaced under subsection (2) or (3) except with a tree farm licence that is also a tree farm licence as described in paragraph (c) of the definition of "licence" in section 75.4 (1).
A replaceable tree farm licence may not be replaced under subsection (2) or (3) except with a tree farm licence that is also replaceable.

A tree farm licence that provides that a replacement for the tree farm licence must not be offered may not be replaced under subsection (2) or (3) except with a tree farm licence that also provides that a replacement for it must not be offered.
Despite section 35 (1) (a), a tree farm licence that is amended or entered into under this section must not expire later than the earliest expiry date of the tree farm licences it replaces or amends.
The minister may change the boundary or area of a tree farm licence with the consent of its holder.
The discretion of the minister under subsection (1) includes the discretion to change the boundary or area of the tree farm licence with the consent of its holder by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: adding private land of the holder of the tree farm licence to the area of the licence, or
removing private land from the area of the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A pulpwood agreement must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term not exceeding 25 years,
describe as a pulpwood area the area described in the agreement as it was on April 1, 2003,
require its holder to construct, expand or continue a timber processing facility in accordance with the application for the pulpwood agreement,
require its holder to purchase, as provided in the pulpwood agreement,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: wood residue produced by timber processing facilities from timber harvested in the pulpwood area, and
pulp logs, as defined in the agreement, from the pulpwood area,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: grant to its holder the option to obtain from the regional manager or district manager, without advertising or competition from other applicants, forestry licences to cut authorizing the harvest from Crown land in the pulpwood area of a maximum annual volume of timber not exceeding the volume, and according to the terms, specified in the pulpwood agreement,
require that its holder must not exercise an option under paragraph (e) without first complying with the requirement under paragraph (d), and
include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a pulpwood agreement that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is in effect after the coming into force of this section, and
was entered into before that time.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consolidation and subdivision of pulpwood agreements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, minister includes a person authorized by the minister.
Subject to this section, the minister, by a method or combination of methods under subsection (5), may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replace 2 or more pulpwood agreements held by the same person with one of those pulpwood agreements held by that person or a new pulpwood agreement held by that person, or
amend a single pulpwood agreement held by a person and enter into one or more pulpwood agreements held by that person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the minister first receives the consent of the holder of the agreements or agreement.
Subject to this section, the minister, by a method or combination of methods under subsection (5), must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replace 2 or more pulpwood agreements held by the same person with one of those pulpwood agreements held by that person or a new pulpwood agreement held by that person, or
amend a single pulpwood agreement held by a person and enter into one or more pulpwood agreements held by that person,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: if the holder requests the replacement or amendment by written request delivered to the minister.
The minister may refuse to replace or amend, under subsection (3), one or more pulpwood agreements if the minister considers that the replacement or amendment would compromise forest management.
For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3), the methods are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deleting all or part of the area from a pulpwood agreement and adding the deleted area to the area of another pulpwood agreement;
cancelling a pulpwood agreement if the area covered by the agreement has been added to the area in another pulpwood agreement;
amending a pulpwood agreement;
entering into one or more pulpwood agreements covering the same land as was covered in the agreement being replaced.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 41 (a) a pulpwood agreement that is amended or entered into under this section must not expire later than the earliest expiry date of the pulpwood agreements it replaces or amends.
On request or on his or her own initiative the minister, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a community forest agreement.
An application for a community forest agreement must meet prescribed requirements.
A community forest agreement may be entered into only with an applicant that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a first nation,
a municipality or regional district, or
any of the following if prescribed requirements are met:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a society as defined in the Societies Act;
an association as defined in the Cooperative Association Act;
a corporation;
a partnership.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must evaluate applications for a community forest agreement in accordance with prescribed requirements.
After evaluating applications under subsection (4), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve an application,
approve an application subject to conditions with which the applicant must comply before the community forest agreement is entered into, or
decline to approve all applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an applicant whose application is approved under subsection (5) does not enter into the community forest agreement, the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve the next best application,
approve the next best application subject to conditions with which the applicant must comply before the community forest agreement is entered into, or
refuse to approve any of the applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (8), the minister must enter into a community forest agreement with every applicant whose application is approved under subsection (5) or (6).
The minister must not enter into a community forest agreement until a management plan is approved by the minister for the proposed community forest agreement area.
The minister may reserve from disposition under this Act the timber in the area described in the advertising, pending

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a community forest agreement being entered into under this section, or
a refusal under subsection (6) to approve any of the applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A community forest agreement

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term of not less than 25 years and not more than 99 years,
must describe a community forest agreement area, determined by the minister or a person authorized by the minister, comprising Crown land and, if the area so determined includes land that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in a reserve as defined in the Indian Act (Canada), or
private land

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: also comprising that land,
subject to this Act and the agreement,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: must give to its holder the exclusive right to harvest timber on the Crown land referred to in paragraph (b), for the term of the agreement, and
may give to its holder the right to harvest, manage and charge fees for botanical forest products and other prescribed products,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7 in respect of Crown timber, and

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the community forest agreement, but, at the holder's discretion, is not cut and removed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must provide for cutting permits with terms that do not exceed 4 years to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the community forest agreement and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize its holder to harvest the allowable annual cut available to its holder from specified areas of land within the community forest agreement area,
must require its holder to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: submit for the approval of the minister, at the times specified in the agreement, a management plan that meets the requirements of the community forest agreement, and
implement management plans approved by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include one or more provisions of Division 3.1 of Part 4 with any variations necessary or desirable to adapt the provision or provisions for the purposes of the agreement,
must require its holder, in accordance with the community forest agreement, to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: carry out audits and make and submit reports concerning the holder's performance under the agreement, and
make information available to the public and carry out consultation activities with the public concerning matters relating to the community forest agreement,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that is entered into with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement, the "other agreement", between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, must state that it is a condition of the community forest agreement that the first nation comply with the other agreement,

may require that a specified amount of timber on Crown land within the community forest agreement area is to be reserved and available for disposition, to persons other than the holder of the community forest agreement, under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: timber sale licences, or
forestry licences to cut under section 47.6 (3),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may require that the amount of timber on Crown land within the community forest agreement area that is available to the holder of the community forest agreement be reduced by a specified amount of timber for a specified period of time for the purpose of entering into one or more BCTS licences, respecting all or part of the specified amount of timber, with one or more persons other than the holder of the community forest agreement, and

may include other terms and conditions that the minister determines are consistent with any proposal made in the application for the community forest agreement, this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A reservation referred to in subsection (1) (g.2) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a community forest agreement entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the community forest agreement already includes the reservation, or
the holder of the community forest agreement agrees to include the reservation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a replacement for a replaceable community forest agreement, unless paragraph (a) (i) or (ii) of this subsection applies in relation to the replaceable community forest agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement described in subsection (1) (g.3) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a community forest agreement entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless the holder of the community forest agreement agrees to include the requirement;
a replacement for a replaceable community forest agreement, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the community forest agreement already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the community forest agreement agrees to include the requirement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: [Repealed 2009-8-9.]

Unless a community forest agreement provides that a replacement for the community forest agreement must not be offered, the minister, during the 6 month period following the ninth anniversary of an existing community forest agreement, must offer the holder a replacement community forest agreement.
A community forest agreement offered under subsection (4) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term of not less than 25 years and not more than 99 years, commencing on the tenth anniversary of the existing community forest agreement,
describe as a community forest agreement area the area subject to the existing community forest agreement and any change to the boundary or area made by the minister under subsection (6), and

include other terms and conditions that are set out in the offer and are consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations, and with the consent of the person to whom a community forest agreement is offered under this section, the minister may change the boundary or area in the offered community forest agreement from the boundary or area of the existing community forest agreement.
Notice of an offer made under this section to replace a community forest agreement must be published in the prescribed manner.
An offer made under this section may be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: amended, and
accepted by written notice to the minister, not later than 3 months after the offer is served.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is accepted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a community forest agreement containing the terms and conditions set out in the offer, including amendments, must be entered into by the minister and the holder of the community forest agreement, and
the existing community forest agreement expires on the commencement of the replacement agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A community forest agreement is not renewable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Direct award of community forest agreements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, representative means a person or other legal entity that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is appointed by a first nation as its representative, and
meets prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a community forest agreement

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, or
under prescribed circumstances or with a holder that meets prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After a community forest agreement has been entered into under subsection (1) with a first nation or its representative, the minister may, if it furthers the objectives set out in subsection (1) (a), and with the consent of the holder of the community forest agreement, increase the area covered by the community forest agreement.
Section 43.2 does not apply to a community forest agreement entered into under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations, and with the consent of the holder of the agreement, the minister may change the boundary or increase the area of a community forest agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition for community forest agreement allowable annual cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: For a community forest agreement for which an allowable annual cut has not been determined under section 8, a reference in this Act or the regulations to an allowable annual cut authorized for a community forest agreement must be read as a reference to the rate of timber harvesting for each community forest agreement area as determined under section 8.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Award of first nations woodland licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, representative means a person or other legal entity that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is appointed by a first nation as its representative, and
meets prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a first nations woodland licence with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures.

After a first nations woodland licence has been entered into under subsection (2), the minister may, if it furthers the objectives set out in subsection (2), and with the consent of the holder of the licence, increase the area covered by the licence.
The minister must not enter into a first nations woodland licence under subsection (2) until
