bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a management plan is approved by the minister for the proposed first nations woodland licence area, and
if required under the agreement between the first nation and the government referred to in subsection (2) of this section, one or more agreements referred to in section 12 are surrendered.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Content of first nations woodland licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A first nations woodland licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term of not less than 25 years and not more than 99 years,
must describe a first nations woodland licence area, determined by the minister, comprising Crown land and, if the area so determined includes land that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in a reserve as defined in the Indian Act (Canada), or
private land,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: also comprising that land,
subject to this Act and the licence,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: must give to its holder the exclusive right to harvest timber on the Crown land referred to in paragraph (b), for the term of the agreement, and
may give to its holder the right to harvest, manage and charge fees for botanical forest products and other prescribed products,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7 in respect of Crown timber, and
waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the licence, but, at the holder's discretion, is not cut and removed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must provide for cutting permits with terms that do not exceed 4 years to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the licence and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize its holder to harvest the allowable annual cut available to its holder from specified areas of Crown land within the first nations woodland licence area,
must require its holder to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: submit for the approval of the minister, at the times specified in the licence, a management plan that meets the requirements of the licence, and
implement management plans approved by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include one or more provisions of Division 3.1 of Part 4 with any variations necessary or desirable to adapt the provision or provisions

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: for the purposes of the licence, or
to take into account the effect of a surrender of an agreement referred to in section 43.54 (4) (b),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must state that it is a condition of the licence that the first nation comply with the agreement between the first nation and the government referred to in section 43.54 (2),

may require that a specified amount of timber on Crown land within the first nations woodland licence area is to be reserved and available for disposition, to persons other than the holder of the first nations woodland licence, under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: timber sale licences, or
forestry licences to cut under section 47.6 (3),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may require that the amount of timber on Crown land within the first nations woodland licence area that is available to the holder of the first nations woodland licence be reduced by a specified amount of timber for a specified period of time for the purpose of entering into one or more BCTS licences, respecting all or part of the specified amount of timber, with one or more persons other than the holder of the first nations woodland licence, and

may include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A reservation referred to in subsection (1) (h.1) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a first nations woodland licence entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless the holder of the first nations woodland licence agrees to include the reservation;

a replacement for a replaceable first nations woodland licence entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless the holder of the replaceable first nations woodland licence agrees to include the reservation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement described in subsection (1) (h.2) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a first nations woodland licence entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless the holder of the first nations woodland licence agrees to include the requirement;
a replacement for a replaceable first nations woodland licence, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the first nations woodland licence already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the first nations woodland licence agrees to include the requirement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Replacement of first nations woodland licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless a first nations woodland licence provides that a replacement for the first nations woodland licence must not be offered, the minister, during the 6 month period following the ninth anniversary of an existing first nations woodland licence, must offer the holder a replacement first nations woodland licence.
A first nations woodland licence offered under subsection (1) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term of not less than 25 years and not more than 99 years, commencing on the tenth anniversary of the existing licence,
describe, as a first nations woodland licence area, the area subject to the existing licence and any change to the boundary or area made by the minister under subsection (3), and

include other terms and conditions that are set out in the offer and are consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations, and with the consent of the person to whom a first nations woodland licence is offered under this section, the minister may change the boundary or area in the offered first nations woodland licence from the boundary or area of the existing first nations woodland licence.
An offer made under this section may be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: amended, and
accepted by written notice to the minister not later than 3 months after the offer is served.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is accepted,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a first nations woodland licence containing the terms and conditions set out in the offer, including amendments, must be entered into by the minister and the holder of the first nations woodland licence, and
the existing first nations woodland licence expires on the commencement of the replacement licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A first nations woodland licence is not renewable.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In accordance with the regulations and with the consent of the holder of the licence, the minister may change the boundary or area of a first nations woodland licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: affiliate has the same meaning as in section 53;
control, in relation to a corporation, has the same meaning as "control of a corporation" in section 53;
ineligible licence means a licence that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a timber sale licence, if the timber sale licence is also a major licence;
a forest licence, other than a forest licence entered into under section 47.3 (1);
a tree farm licence;
a forestry licence to cut, other than a forestry licence to cut entered into under section 47.3 (1), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is either

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: replaceable, or
non-replaceable, with an original term greater than 5 years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request or on his or her own initiative the minister, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a woodlot licence.
An application for a woodlot licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made to a person designated by the minister, and
meet prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (5) and (5.1), a woodlot licence may be entered into only with an applicant that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a Canadian citizen or permanent resident of Canada who is 19 years of age or older,
a first nation, or
a corporation, other than a society, that is controlled by persons who meet the qualifications referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A woodlot licence may not be entered into with an applicant that is not a corporation if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant holds 2 or more woodlot licences;
the applicant controls a corporation that holds 2 or more woodlot licences;
the applicant holds a woodlot licence and controls a corporation that holds a woodlot licence;
the applicant controls a corporation that holds a woodlot licence and the corporation is affiliated with another corporation that holds a woodlot licence;
the applicant holds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an ineligible licence that has an allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3, or
2 or more ineligible licences that together have an aggregate allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant controls a corporation that holds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an ineligible licence described in paragraph (e) (i), or
2 or more ineligible licences described in paragraph (e) (ii);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant holds an ineligible licence and controls a corporation that holds an ineligible licence and those ineligible licences together have an aggregate allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3;

the applicant controls a corporation that holds an ineligible licence and the corporation is affiliated with another corporation that holds an ineligible licence and those ineligible licences together have an aggregate allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A woodlot licence may not be entered into with an applicant that is a corporation if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant holds 2 or more woodlot licences;
the applicant is affiliated with another corporation that holds 2 or more woodlot licences;
the applicant holds a woodlot licence and is affiliated with another corporation that holds a woodlot licence;
the applicant holds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an ineligible licence that has an allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3, or
2 or more ineligible licences that together have an aggregate allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant is affiliated with another corporation that holds

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an ineligible licence described in paragraph (d) (i), or
2 or more ineligible licences described in paragraph (d) (ii);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant holds an ineligible licence and is affiliated with another corporation that holds an ineligible licence and those ineligible licences together have an aggregate allowable annual cut that is greater than 10 000 m3.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must evaluate applications for a woodlot licence in accordance with prescribed requirements.
After evaluating applications under subsection (6), the person who evaluated the applications may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve an application, or
decline to approve all applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an applicant whose application is approved under subsection (7) neglects or declines to enter into the woodlot licence or becomes ineligible to enter into the licence, the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve the next best application, or
refuse to approve any of the applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (10), the minister must enter into a woodlot licence with every person whose application is approved under subsection (7) or (8).
The minister must not enter into a woodlot licence until a management plan is approved by the government for the proposed woodlot licence area.
The minister may reserve from disposition under this Act the timber in the area described in the advertising, pending

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a woodlot licence being entered into under this section, or
a refusal under subsection (8) to approve any of the applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A woodlot licence must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term not exceeding 20 years,
describe a woodlot licence area determined by the minister to be composed of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: private land owned or held under lease by its holder or a reserve as defined in the Indian Act (Canada), if so determined by the minister, and
Crown land, the timber on which is not otherwise encumbered, of not more than

bcl:clause.bcl:text: 800 ha if the Crown land is located in the Coast Forest Region, or
1 200 ha if the Crown land is not located in the Coast Forest Region,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to the provisions of this Act, give to its holder the exclusive right to harvest timber on the Crown land referred to in paragraph (b), for its term,
require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7 in respect of Crown timber,

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the woodlot licence, but, at the holder's discretion, is not cut and removed, and
a bonus, if any, in the amount tendered,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide for cutting permits with terms that do not exceed 4 years to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the woodlot licence and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize its holder to harvest timber from specified areas of land within the woodlot licence area,
require its holder to submit for the approval of the minister, at the times specified by the minister, a management plan that meets all the following requirements:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: it is prepared in accordance with the requirements of the woodlot licence;
it includes inventories, prepared in the manner, presented in the format and meeting the specifications required under the woodlot licence, of the timber resources within the woodlot licence area;
it is consistent with

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the woodlot licence,
this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, and
any applicable objectives set by government;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: it proposes management objectives, in accordance with the woodlot licence, regarding

bcl:clause.bcl:text: utilization of the timber resources in the woodlot licence area,
protection and conservation of the non-timber values and resources in the woodlot licence area,
forest fire prevention and suppression,
forest health, including pest management,
silviculture, and
road construction, maintenance and deactivation;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: it includes proposals, in accordance with the woodlot licence, for meeting the proposed management objectives under subparagraph (iv), including measures to be taken and specifications to be followed by the holder of the woodlot licence;
it proposes an allowable annual cut for the woodlot licence area;
it includes any other inventories and information regarding the development, management and use of the woodlot licence area that the minister, in accordance with the woodlot licence, requires,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the licence is entered into with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, state that it is a condition of the licence that the first nation comply with the agreement,

may require that the amount of timber on Crown land within the woodlot licence area that is available to the holder of the woodlot licence be reduced by a specified amount of timber for a specified period of time for the purpose of entering into one or more BCTS licences, respecting all or part of the specified amount of timber, with one or more persons other than the holder of the woodlot licence, and

include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), the Crown land portion of a woodlot licence may exceed the limits specified in subsection (1) (b) (ii) (A) or (B) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the woodlot licence was entered into before January 1, 2003, and
the excess Crown land was included in the woodlot licence as a result of mapping inaccuracies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A requirement described in subsection (1) (f.2) must not be included in the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a woodlot licence entered into before the date this subsection comes into force, unless the holder of the woodlot licence agrees to include the requirement;
a replacement for a woodlot licence under section 46 or 46.2, unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the woodlot licence that is replaced already includes the requirement, or
the holder of the woodlot licence that replaces a woodlot licence agrees to include the requirement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition for woodlot licence allowable annual cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: For a woodlot licence for which an allowable annual cut has not been determined under section 8, a reference in this Act or the regulations to an allowable annual cut authorized for a woodlot licence must be read as a reference to the volume of timber to be harvested from each woodlot licence area during each year or other period of the term of the woodlot licence as determined under section 8.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless a woodlot licence provides that a replacement for the woodlot licence must not be offered, the minister, during the 6 month period following the ninth anniversary of an existing woodlot licence, must offer its holder a replacement for the woodlot licence.
Despite subsection (1), if the minister determines that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: rights under the existing woodlot licence are under suspension, or
the holder of the existing woodlot licence has failed to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: pay stumpage or other money payable in respect of timber harvested under the woodlot licence or a road permit associated with the woodlot licence,
provide security or a deposit required under this Act or the Forest and Range Practices Act in respect of the woodlot licence or a road permit associated with the woodlot licence,
perform an obligation under the woodlot licence to be performed by the holder in respect of an area of land specified in

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a cutting permit previously issued under the woodlot licence, or
a road permit associated with the woodlot licence, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with a requirement under this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Wildfire Act in respect of an area of land referred to in subparagraph (iii),

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the minister, to the extent provided in the regulations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may decline to offer a replacement for the existing woodlot licence until

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the suspension is rescinded,
the suspended rights are reinstated, or
the holder of the existing woodlot licence

bcl:clause.bcl:text: pays the stumpage or other money payable,
provides the required security or deposit,
performs the obligation to be performed under the existing woodlot licence in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), or
complies with the requirement under this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Wildfire Act in respect of land referred to in paragraph (b) (iii), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may offer a replacement with special conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A woodlot licence offered under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: have a term commencing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on the 10th anniversary of the existing woodlot licence, or
if the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), on a date to be determined by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be for a term equal to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the whole original term of the existing woodlot licence, or
if the minister exercises the power conferred under subsection (2) (c), a period, not exceeding the original term of the existing woodlot licence, to be determined by the minister,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe as a woodlot licence area the area subject to the existing woodlot licence, and
include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, set out in the offer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: [Repealed 1999-10-5.]
Notice of an offer made under this section must be published in the prescribed manner.
An offer made under this section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may be amended, and
may be accepted by written notice to a person designated by the minister not later than 3 months after the offer is served.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is accepted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a woodlot licence containing the terms and conditions set out in the offer, including amendments, must be entered into by the minister and the holder of the woodlot licence, and
the existing woodlot licence expires on the commencement of the replacement licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an offer made under this section is not accepted, the existing woodlot licence continues in force until its term expires, after which it has no further effect.
No woodlot licence is renewable.

Subject to this section, the minister, by a method or combination of methods under subsection (2), may replace 2 woodlot licences held by the same person with one of those woodlot licences held by that person or a new woodlot licence held by that person, if the minister first receives the consent of the holder of the licences.
For the purposes of subsection (1), the methods are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deleting all or part of the licence area from a woodlot licence and adding the deleted area to the licence area of another woodlot licence;
cancelling a woodlot licence if all or part of the area covered by the licence has been added to the licence area in another woodlot licence;
amending a woodlot licence;
entering into a woodlot licence covering all or part of the same area as was covered in the licences being replaced;
subject to subsection (3), specifying the allowable annual cuts that will apply to areas covered by the woodlot licences amended or entered into under this subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making a replacement referred to in subsection (1), the minister must ensure that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the amended or new woodlot licence does not exceed the total of the allowable annual cuts of the replaced woodlot licences as they were immediately before the replacement, and
after the replacement, the Crown land in the amended or new woodlot licence area does not exceed the limits set in section 45 (1) (b) (ii).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A woodlot licence as described in paragraph (a.1) of the definition of "licence" in section 75.4 (1) may not be replaced under subsection (1) of this section except with a woodlot licence that is also a woodlot licence as described in paragraph (a.1) of the definition of "licence" in section 75.4 (1).
A replaceable woodlot licence may not be replaced under subsection (1) except with a woodlot licence that is also replaceable.

A woodlot licence that provides that a replacement for the woodlot licence must not be offered may not be replaced under subsection (1) except with a woodlot licence that also provides that a replacement for it must not be offered.
Despite section 45 (1) (a), a woodlot licence that is amended or entered into under this section must not expire later than the earliest expiry date of the woodlot licence it replaces.
In accordance with the regulations, if any, and with the consent of the holder of the woodlot licence, the minister may change the boundary or area of a woodlot licence.
The discretion of the minister under subsection (1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is subject to section 45 (1) (b) (ii), and
includes the discretion to change the boundary or area of the woodlot licence with the consent of its holder by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: adding private land owned or leased by the holder to the woodlot licence area, or
removing private land from the woodlot licence area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, representative means a person or other legal entity that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is appointed by a first nation as its representative, and
meets prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a forest licence, woodlot licence, forestry licence to cut or fibre supply licence to cut with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures,
a person to mitigate the effects on that person of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a treaty,
a specification of a designated area under Part 13, or
an agreement between a first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant of an eligible bioenergy application approved under section 13.1 (3), if the licence is a fibre supply licence to cut and, in the opinion of the minister, Crown timber is required for the purpose of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: achieving the commercial operation date as set out in the bioenergy supply contract associated with the application, or

supplying Crown timber to the power plant described in the bioenergy supply contract associated with the application until timber is obtained under the forest licence entered into under section 13.1 (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After a licence has been entered into under subsection (1) with a first nation or its representative, the minister may, if it furthers the objectives set out in subsection (1) (a), and with the consent of the holder of the licence, do one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: increase

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut or the maximum harvestable volume, or both, specified in the licence, if the licence is a forest licence,
the maximum harvestable volume, if the licence is a forestry licence to cut,
the area covered by the licence if the licence is a forestry licence to cut, or
subject to section 45 (1) (b) (ii), the area covered by the licence if the licence is a woodlot licence;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: extend the term of the licence, if the licence is a forest licence, forestry licence to cut or fibre supply licence to cut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The extension of the term of a licence under subsection (3) (b) must not result in the total term of the licence exceeding

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 10 years, if the licence is a forestry licence to cut or fibre supply licence to cut, or
20 years, if the licence is a forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 47.72 (1) (a), after a fibre supply licence to cut has been entered into under subsection (1) (c) of this section, the minister may, if it furthers the objectives set out in subsection (1) (c) (i) or (ii), and with the consent of the holder of the licence to cut, extend the term of that licence to cut.
The extension under subsection (5) of the term of a fibre supply licence to cut must not result in the total term of the licence to cut exceeding 10 years.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Licence to cut for persons occupying land or for energy resource purposes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an occupant licence to cut with an owner or occupier of land, authorizing the person to cut Crown timber on the land, remove Crown timber from the land or do both, or
a master licence to cut with any person, authorizing the harvesting of timber, under a cutting permit referred to in section 47.5 (2) (c) in all or part of a forest district

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: for one or more of the following purposes:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: an energy resource activity under the Energy Resource Activities Act;
roads associated with an activity referred to in clause (A), or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to authorize the person to harvest timber for prescribed purposes or in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Content of occupant and master licences to cut

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An occupant licence to cut

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must require its holder, if it authorizes its holder to both cut and remove Crown timber, to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7, and

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the occupant licence to cut, but, at the holder's discretion, is not cut and removed, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include other terms and conditions that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are determined by the minister, and
are consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A master licence to cut

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 10 years,
must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7, and

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the master licence to cut, but, at its holder's discretion, is not cut and removed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must provide for cutting permits to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the master licence to cut and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act or the Energy Resource Activities Act, as applicable, to authorize its holder to harvest Crown timber from specified areas within the area or areas of Crown land specified in the licence to cut, and
may include other terms and conditions that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are determined by the minister, and
are consistent with this Act and the Wildfire Act and with the applicable of the Forest and Range Practices Act and the Energy Resource Activities Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The district manager or the forest officer authorized by the district manager must not issue to the holder of a master licence to cut a cutting permit for an area described in subsection (2) (c) unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has written authority from the government, or
is authorized under an enactment

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to occupy that area, or
the cutting permit will facilitate harvesting for the purposes or circumstances referred to in section 47.4 (2) (b) (ii).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a master licence to cut expires and the minister enters into a new master licence to cut with the same holder, a cutting permit issued under the expired master licence to cut must be assigned to the new master licence to cut if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder consents to the assignment,
the areas of land specified in the cutting permit are within the area or areas of Crown land specified in the new master licence to cut, and
no changes are made to the cutting permit, other than the assignment of that permit to the new master licence to cut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in which the volume of timber specified does not exceed 500 m3 and the timber, in the opinion of the regional manager or district manager, is to be harvested under controlled scientific or investigative conditions,
specifying a volume of timber that does not exceed 50 m3,
to authorize only the removal of Crown timber from Crown land or private land,
if authorized to do so under another provision of this Act, or
to authorize the harvesting of timber for prescribed purposes or in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the forestry licence to cut authorizes its holder, in specified areas within the area or areas of Crown land identified in the forestry licence to cut, to do any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: remove Crown timber;
process felled Crown timber into chips or other products and remove those products, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister has received notification under section 79.1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The timber sales manager may enter into a forestry licence to cut with a person, authorizing the person to cut Crown timber on Crown land, remove Crown timber from Crown land or do both, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is contracted by the government to carry out an activity funded out of the BC Timber Sales Account, and
the timber sales manager considers it desirable to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: cut, or
cut and remove

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: timber from the contract area in conjunction with the contract.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: harvesting under the forestry licence to cut is restricted to timber that, in the opinion of the regional manager or district manager, is required to be cut and removed in order to reduce the spread of an insect infestation, and

the harvesting of the timber is in conjunction with a competitively awarded forest health project that is consistent with a government approved bark beetle management strategy for the management unit in which the harvesting is to take place.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut with the applicant of an eligible bioenergy application approved under section 13.1 (3) on or after the date the application is approved if, in the opinion of the minister, Crown timber is required for the purpose of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: achieving the commercial operation date as set out in the bioenergy supply contract associated with the application, or

supplying Crown timber to the power plant described in the bioenergy supply contract associated with the application until timber is obtained under the forest licence entered into under section 13.1 (5).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Content of forestry licence to cut

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 5 years,
must describe one or more areas of land and identify for each area whether the holder may do one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: harvest Crown timber;
cut Crown timber;
remove Crown timber;
process Crown timber and remove the processed timber,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may specify a volume of timber that may be harvested from an area of land described in the forestry licence to cut,
may specify that the forestry licence to cut is a major licence,

may provide for cutting permits, which, if the forestry licence to cut is a major licence, must have terms that do not exceed 4 years, to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the licence to cut and, subject to this Act, to authorize its holder to harvest Crown timber from specified areas of land within the area or areas of land described in the forestry licence to cut,
must require its holder, if it authorizes its holder to remove Crown timber, to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: stumpage under Part 7, and

waste assessments for merchantable Crown timber, whether standing or felled, that could have been cut and removed under the forestry licence to cut other than a forestry licence to cut issued under section 47.6 (2.11), but, at the holder's discretion, is not removed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that is entered into with a first nation or its representative to implement or further an agreement between the first nation and the government respecting treaty-related measures, interim measures or economic measures, must state that it is a condition of the forestry licence to cut that the first nation comply with the agreement,
may include provisions

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specifying standards and programs established by one or more standard making bodies,
requiring the holder of the licence to meet the standards and programs specified under subparagraph (i), and
specifying the manner in which the holder of the licence must conduct operations under the licence in order to meet the standards and programs specified under subparagraph (i), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister or timber sales manager.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Applications for fibre supply licence to cut

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request or on his or her own initiative the minister, by advertising in the prescribed manner, may invite applications for a fibre supply licence to cut.
An application for a fibre supply licence to cut must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made to a person designated by the minister, and
meet prescribed requirements.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must evaluate applications for a fibre supply licence to cut in accordance with prescribed requirements.
After evaluating applications under subsection (3), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve an application, or
decline to approve all applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an applicant whose application is approved under subsection (4) neglects or declines to enter into the fibre supply licence to cut, the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve the next best application, or
refuse to approve any of the applications.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must enter into a fibre supply licence to cut with every person whose application is approved under subsection (4) or (5).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Content of a fibre supply licence to cut

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A fibre supply licence to cut

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 10 years,
must require its holder to pay to the government, in addition to other amounts payable under this Act, stumpage under Part 7,

must provide for fibre recovery permits to be issued by the district manager, or a forest officer authorized by the district manager, within the limits provided in the fibre supply licence to cut and subject to this Act and the Forest and Range Practices Act, to authorize its holder in specified areas within the area or areas of land identified in the fibre supply licence to cut to do any of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: remove Crown timber;
process felled Crown timber into chips or other products and remove those products,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include provisions specifying one or more standard making bodies and requiring the holder of the fibre supply licence to cut to conduct its operations under the fibre supply licence to cut in accordance with principles, standards and criteria established by the standard making body or bodies,

may include other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister, and

may include other terms and conditions that the minister considers necessary or desirable respecting operations under the fibre supply licence to cut as they relate to the holder of an agreement listed in section 12 who is required to provide notification in accordance with section 79.1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The district manager or the forest officer authorized by the district manager must not issue to the holder of a fibre supply licence to cut a fibre recovery permit for an area described in subsection (1) (c) unless the district manager has received notification in accordance with section 79.1 for the specified areas referred to in subsection (1) (c) that are to be subject to the fibre recovery permit from the holder of an agreement listed in section 12 who is required to provide notification in accordance with section 79.1.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Volume deemed to be harvested under licence for cut control purposes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2) and for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "volume of timber harvested" in section 75.1 (1), the amount of timber that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is merchantable Crown timber, and
is removed under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a forestry licence to cut entered into under section 47.6 (2.11), or
a fibre recovery permit issued under a fibre supply licence to cut

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: is deemed to be harvested under the agreement of the agreement holder who gave the notification in accordance with section 79.1.

Subsection (1) does not apply if the amount of timber removed or harvested under the forestry licence to cut or removed under the fibre recovery permit has already been attributed to the agreement referred to in subsection (1) for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "volume of timber harvested" in section 75.1 (1).

bcl:division.bcl:text: Disposition of Timber Acquired under Forestry Revitalization Act or Subject to Waste Assessment

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposition of timber in a tree farm licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may make available for disposition under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Divisions 2 and 3 of Part 3,
section 47.3 under a forest licence or forestry licence to cut, or
section 47.6 (2) or (3),

bcl:section.bcl:text: to persons other than the holder of a tree farm licence for all or part of a tree farm licence area, portions of the allowable annual cut available that is the subject of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reduction in allowable annual cut under section 2 (3) of the Forestry Revitalization Act, and
an attribution made under section 3 (2) of that Act by an order of the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposition of timber not harvested or removed under an agreement
bcl:section.bcl:text: Timber that is not harvested or removed under an agreement listed in section 12 and in respect of which a notification must be given in accordance with section 79.1 may be the subject of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a forestry licence to cut entered into under section 47.6 (2.11), or
a fibre supply licence to cut.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Free Use Permits for First Nations and Others

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A free use permit must be entered into only with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an occupier of land who requires Crown timber for developing the land for agricultural purposes,
a person who requires a Christmas tree for their personal use and not for sale to others,
a person who requires firewood for their personal domestic purposes and not for sale to others,
a board of education that requires firewood for school purposes,
a person who requires Crown timber for the purpose of scientific investigation,
an owner of a Crown grant of a mineral claim, authorizing the use of Crown timber on land described in the grant in a mining operation conducted on that land,
a holder of a coal licence issued under the Coal Act, or a holder of a mineral title under the Mineral Tenure Act not in production authorizing the holder to cut timber,
a person who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: requires Crown timber for a traditional and cultural activity, within the meaning prescribed for the phrase "traditional and cultural activity", and
is not selling the timber to others, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a treaty first nation that has entered into an agreement with British Columbia, in accordance with its final agreement, for the harvesting of types of timber specified in the final agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), a free use permit must not be entered into with an applicant described in subsection (1) (a) to (f) and (h) if, on land the applicant owns or occupies, there is sufficient timber that is reasonably accessible for the purpose specified in the application.
If a person who requires Crown timber under subsection (1) (g) wishes to harvest more than 50 m3 under the free use permit, the person must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: apply to a person designated by the minister, and
include in the application the information required by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) does not apply in relation to a treaty first nation referred to in subsection (1) (h) to the extent its application would be inconsistent with the final agreement or the agreement referred to in subsection (1) (h).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Issuance and content of free use permit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a free use permit with a person or treaty first nation qualified under section 48.
A free use permit

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 1 year, if the permit is entered into with an applicant described in section 48 (1), other than an applicant described in paragraph (e) or (f) of that section, and
5 years, if the permit is entered into with an applicant described in section 48 (1) (e) or (f),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must give to its holder the right to harvest Crown timber from an area of land for the purposes specified in it,
subject to subsection (2.1), must be limited to a volume not exceeding 50 m3,
despite Part 4, Division 4, may be suspended or cancelled, or both, without notice by the minister if its holder fails to comply with its terms and conditions, this Act or the regulations,
must not require its holder to pay stumpage for the timber cut, or to pay rent, and
may contain terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister, in prescribed circumstances, may enter into a free use permit authorized under section 48 (1) (g) for a volume exceeding 50 m3.
Despite subsection (2), a free use permit entered into with a treaty first nation

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be for a term not exceeding 5 years,
must give the treaty first nation the right to harvest

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the type of timber specified in the final agreement from an area of Crown land for the purposes specified in that final agreement, and
the amount of timber specified in the agreement referred to in section 48 (1) (h) for each year of the term,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may contain terms and conditions, consistent with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts,
the final agreement of the treaty first nation, and
the agreement referred to in section 48 (1) (h),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: determined by the minister, and
is subject to subsection (2) (d) and (e).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The person or treaty first nation

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of which a decision is made under subsection (2) or (2.2) (d), or
in respect of which a decision is made under subsection (2) or (2.2) (d) relating to the free use permit to which the person or treaty first nation is a party,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: may require a review of the decision by a person authorized by the minister and the decision of the authorized person is final and binding.
Only sections 143 (2), 144 and 145 apply to a review under subsection (3).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Free use permit in area subject to area-based licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section and despite the definition of "area-based licence" in section 1 (1), area-based licence means a community forest agreement, a first nations woodland licence or a woodlot licence.

With the consent of the holder of an area-based licence, the minister may enter into a free use permit authorizing the holder of the permit to harvest timber from Crown land within the area subject to the area-based licence.
Despite sections 48 (1) and 49 (1), the minister may enter into a free use permit under this section only with an applicant described in section 48 (1) (a.1), (b), (c), (d), (g) or (h).

Despite subsection (3), the minister must not enter into a free use permit with an applicant described in section 48 (1) (a.1), (b), (c), (d) or (h) if, on land the applicant owns or occupies, there is sufficient timber that is reasonably accessible for the purpose specified in the application.

Section 49 (2) and (2.2) applies to a free use permit entered into under this section except that the minister may not, under section 49 (2.1), enter into a free use permit with an applicant described in section 48 (1) (g) for a volume exceeding 50 m3.
Sections 48 (3) and 49 (3) and (4) do not apply in respect of a free use permit entered into under this section.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Christmas Tree Permits and Government Use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may enter into a Christmas tree permit that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorizes the permittee to harvest or grow and harvest Christmas trees on Crown land,
requires the payment of the deposits and fees prescribed by the minister, and

includes other terms and conditions, consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts, as determined by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section, the minister may prescribe different deposits and different rates or amounts of fees.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Use by government employees and agents

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister or timber sales manager may, in writing, authorize

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: employees acting in the course of their duties, and
agents of the government acting in accordance with the terms of the agency

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: to harvest Crown timber or to use and occupy Crown land in a Provincial forest.
An authorization under subsection (1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is an agreement under the Forest Act for the purposes of the definition of "forest practice" in the Forest and Range Practices Act, and

may include terms and conditions that the minister or timber sales manager considers appropriate and that are consistent with this Act, the Forest and Range Practices Act, the Wildfire Act and any regulations or standards made under those Acts.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister or timber sales manager so specifies in the authorization, the Forest and Range Practices Act applies to the authorization as if the authorization were a forestry licence to cut.
